alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 7:32AM CDT until April 05 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN JASPER...EASTERN NEWTON...NORTHERN CLARKE AND LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 732 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martin to near Paulding, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Marion and Daleville around 740 AM CDT. Meridian Station around 745 AM CDT. Stonewall around 750 AM CDT. Lauderdale and Toomsuba around 755 AM CDT. Kewanee around 800 AM CDT. Sykes and Middleton around 805 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Chunky and Hickory. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
